stir.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together
stir.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Stir the paint to make sure it is smooth.
She stirred her coffee with a plastic spoon.
Stir a cup of cooked brown rice into the mixture.
stir.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to move slightly, or to make something move slightly
stir.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The crowd began to stir as they waited for the band to start.
A gentle breeze stirred the curtains.
stir.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to leave or move from a place
stir.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: He hadnâ€™t stirred from his chair all morning.
stir.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to make someone have a strong feeling or reaction
stir.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The poem succeeds in stirring the imagination.
Looking at the photographs stirred childhood memories of the long hot summers.
stir.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if a feeling stirs in you, you begin to feel it
stir.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to make someone start doing something
stir.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The incident stirred students to protest.
stir.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a feeling of excitement or annoyance
stir.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Plans for the motorway caused quite a stir among locals.
stir.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Give that pan a stir, will you?
